snippet: A general said that for now neither the rebels nor President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and Hezbollah, the Lebanese Shiite militia assisting him, were interested in engaging Israel.
abstract: Brig Gen Ofek Buchris, Israel's army division commander in Golan Heights, says he has counted 15 intentional attacks from across once-quiet Syrian border since March; Buchris calls attacks more nuisance than threat and says while he is confident that neither rebels nor Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad and Hezbollah are interested in engaging Israel, warns that sooner or later serious attacks could begin.
lead_paragraph: A general said that for now neither the rebels nor President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and Hezbollah, the Lebanese Shiite militia assisting him, were interested in engaging Israel.

headline.main: At Golan Heights, Israel Eyes Syria Chaos
headline.print_headline: At Golan Heights, Israel Eyes Syria Chaos
